title: Consequences for nefarious activity in space
summary: The U.S. Space Force is working with allies to establish international norms of behavior for space activity and to share a common operating picture of activity occurring in space.

title: SpaceX retires old Starship vehicles, puts new ones to the test
summary: SpaceX is continuing to make progress with its prototype Starship vehicles, with Booster 7 undergoing a full cryoproofing test on Monday night.

title: New Chinese small sat manufacturing capacity could have international ramifications
summary: Two new Chinese factories capable of producing hundreds of small satellites per year could help China achieve space objectives and impact the international market.

title: That time when Soviet rocket scientists nearly nuked New York City
summary: "The world was standing on the brink of thermonuclear war."

title: SpaceX rolls out Dragon and Falcon 9 for second private astronaut launch
summary: A flight-proven Falcon 9 rocket and Crew Dragon spacecraft have rolled out of SpaceX’s Kennedy Space Center (KSC) Pad 39A hangar and...

title: SLS countdown test on hold after second scrub
summary: After a series of problems scrubbed a second countdown rehearsal for the Space Launch System April 4, NASA will wait until after the launch of a SpaceX mission to the space station before trying again.

title: Tory Bruno: Amazon’s launch contracts a ‘big deal’ for U.S. and allies’ industrial competitiveness
summary: Tory Bruno said Amazon's launch contracts are not just significant for the winners but also for the industrial competitiveness of Western nations following Russia’s exit from the global launch market

title: NASA's Pioneering Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Awarded Collier Trophy
summary: The first aircraft to achieve powered, controlled flight on another planet has garnered an award whose past recipients make up a timeline of aerospace innovation and achievement.

title: Speedcast sees a dearth of satellite capacity ahead
summary: Demand for satellite communications has outstripped supply in markets recovering from the pandemic, according to satcoms provider Speedcast CEO Joe Spytek.

title: Amazon hails progress in driving down Project Kuiper antenna costs
summary: Amazon executive said the cost to produce antennas for its proposed Project Kuiper megaconstellation is already “well under $500,” even as SpaceX retreats from the subsidized $499 price it charges customers for its operational Starlink terminals.
